briefdescription.para: Equal.
Less than.
Less than or equal.
False.
Not equal.
Not less than.
Not less than or equal.
True.
Represents binary operations between two boolean values.
64-byte aligned memory allocator

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t *result, const uint64_t *operand1, const uint64_t *operand2, uint64_t n, uint64_t modulus)
memberdef.name: EltwiseAddMod

briefdescription.para: Adds two vectors elementwise with modular reduction.

detaileddescription.para:
result
Stores result
operand1
Vector of elements to add. Each element must be less than the modulus
operand2
Vector of elements to add. Each element must be less than the modulus
n
Number of elements in each vector
modulus
Modulus with which to perform modular reduction. Must be in the range $[2, 2^{63} - 1]$
Computes $ operand1[i] = (operand1[i] + operand2[i]) \mod modulus $ for $ i=0, ..., n-1$.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t *result, const uint64_t *operand1, uint64_t operand2, uint64_t n, uint64_t modulus)
memberdef.name: EltwiseAddMod

briefdescription.para: Adds a vector and scalar elementwise with modular reduction.

detaileddescription.para:
result
Stores result
operand1
Vector of elements to add. Each element must be less than the modulus
operand2
Scalar to add. Must be less than the modulus
n
Number of elements in each vector
modulus
Modulus with which to perform modular reduction. Must be in the range $[2, 2^{63} - 1]$
Computes $ operand1[i] = (operand1[i] + operand2) \mod modulus $ for $ i=0, ..., n-1$.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t *result, const uint64_t *operand1, uint64_t n, CMPINT cmp, uint64_t bound, uint64_t diff)
memberdef.name: EltwiseCmpAdd

briefdescription.para: Computes element-wise conditional addition.

detaileddescription.para:
result
Stores the result
operand1
Vector of elements to compare; stores result
n
Number of elements in operand1
cmp
Comparison operation
bound
Scalar to compare against
diff
Scalar to conditionally add
Computes result[i] = cmp(operand1[i], bound) ? operand1[i] + diff : operand1[i] for all $i=0, ..., n-1$.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t *result, const uint64_t *operand1, uint64_t n, uint64_t modulus, CMPINT cmp, uint64_t bound, uint64_t diff)
memberdef.name: EltwiseCmpSubMod

briefdescription.para: Computes element-wise conditional modular subtraction.

detaileddescription.para:
result
Stores the result
operand1
Vector of elements to compare
n
Number of elements in operand1
modulus
Modulus to reduce by
cmp
Comparison function
bound
Scalar to compare against
diff
Scalar to subtract by
Computes operand1[i] = (cmp(operand1, bound)) ? (operand1 - diff) mod modulus : operand1 for all i=0, ..., n-1

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t *result, const uint64_t *arg1, uint64_t arg2, const uint64_t *arg3, uint64_t n, uint64_t modulus, uint64_t input_mod_factor)
memberdef.name: EltwiseFMAMod

briefdescription.para: Computes fused multiply-add (arg1 * arg2 + arg3) mod modulus element-wise, broadcasting scalars to vectors.

parameterdescription.para: Vector to add. Will not add if arg3 == nullptr
Number of elements in each vector
Modulus with which to perform modular reduction. Must be in the range $ [2, 2^{61} - 1]$
Assumes input elements are in [0, input_mod_factor * modulus). Must be 1, 2, 4, or 8.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t *result, const uint64_t *operand1, const uint64_t *operand2, uint64_t n, uint64_t modulus, uint64_t input_mod_factor)
memberdef.name: EltwiseMultMod

briefdescription.para: Multiplies two vectors elementwise with modular reduction.

detaileddescription.para:
result
Result of element-wise multiplication
operand1
Vector of elements to multiply. Each element must be less than the modulus.
operand2
Vector of elements to multiply. Each element must be less than the modulus.
n
Number of elements in each vector
modulus
Modulus with which to perform modular reduction
input_mod_factor
Assumes input elements are in [0, input_mod_factor * p) Must be 1, 2 or 4.
Computes result[i] = (operand1[i] * operand2[i]) mod modulus for i=0, ..., n - 1

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t *result, const uint64_t *operand, uint64_t n, uint64_t modulus, uint64_t input_mod_factor, uint64_t output_mod_factor)
memberdef.name: EltwiseReduceMod

briefdescription.para: Performs elementwise modular reduction.

parameterdescription.para: Data on which to compute the elementwise modular reduction
Modulus with which to perform modular reduction

Assumes input elements are in [0, input_mod_factor * p) Must be 0, 1, 2 or 4. input_mod_factor=0 means, no knowledge of input range. Barrett reduction will be used in this case. input_mod_factor >= output_mod_factor unless input_mod_factor == 0
output elements will be in [0, output_mod_factor * modulus) Must be 1 or 2. For input_mod_factor=0, output_mod_factor will be set to 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t *result, const uint64_t *operand1, const uint64_t *operand2, uint64_t n, uint64_t modulus)
memberdef.name: EltwiseSubMod

briefdescription.para: Subtracts two vectors elementwise with modular reduction.

detaileddescription.para:
result
Stores result
operand1
Vector of elements to subtract from. Each element must be less than the modulus
operand2
Vector of elements to subtract. Each element must be less than the modulus
n
Number of elements in each vector
modulus
Modulus with which to perform modular reduction. Must be in the range $[2, 2^{63} - 1]$
Computes $ operand1[i] = (operand1[i] - operand2[i]) \mod modulus $ for $ i=0, ..., n-1$.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint64_t *result, const uint64_t *operand1, uint64_t operand2, uint64_t n, uint64_t modulus)
memberdef.name: EltwiseSubMod

briefdescription.para: Subtracts a scalar from a vector elementwise with modular reduction.

detaileddescription.para:
result
Stores result
operand1
Vector of elements to subtract from. Each element must be less than the modulus
operand2
Elements to subtract. Each element must be less than the modulus
n
Number of elements in each vector
modulus
Modulus with which to perform modular reduction. Must be in the range $[2, 2^{63} - 1]$
Computes $ operand1[i] = (operand1[i] - operand2) \mod modulus $ for $ i=0, ..., n-1$.

Reverses the bits.

simplesect.para: The bit-reversed representation of x using bit_width bits

briefdescription.para: Returns the logical negation of a binary operation.
